The company work across the whole Microsoft stack, and you will be working in a current team of eight, being the expert on all things Dynamics. Working in an Agile environment, you will be expected to work alongside other developers who specialise in other Microsoft tools such as NetSuite and SQL Server.

£38,000 - £55,000 a yearPermanentDo you want to work for quite probably the biggest Fintech company in the World? From their friendly and central Edinburgh office? They're a growing organisation who have been established in Edinburgh for many years - a hugely successful company, whose Edinburgh office has retained a close-knit feel.

Joining the team in a Senior position, you should have solid commercial experience with Java and Swing (bonus skills: C#/.NET, Oracle, PL/SQL, JavaScript, React or other frameworks/libraries, cloud technologies/AWS) and good exposure to Agile practices.

If you can champion Agile practices within the organisation, this is a huge bonus. If you can mentor your colleagues and help them upskill with modern web and cloud technologies (JavaScript, React, AWS) then this would also be massively advantageous; the team are working towards a more product-based setup and moving towards the cloud.

It is important to the company that their Engineers are constantly challenged and learning new things. They hold regular career development/review meetings and the team have access to online resources to keep their skills sharp. They hold regular "lunch and learn" sessions - with pizza and industry experts sharing their knowledge.

The team in Edinburgh totals circa 65 (with 45 working in Development and Test) and so it's a sizeable operation, but they have developed great company culture; the team are close-knit and friendly and they have regular social events (company-wide as well as events more tailored to your specific interests; whether that's running or D&D!). The office has a relaxed atmosphere (without being unmotivated!) and the dress code is casual; you're not expected to be suited and booted every day!

There is a strong package of benefits on offer; contributory pension, discretionary bonuses, flexible working (including some work from home), cycle to work and secure bike facilities and showers, medical/healthcare, the ability to buy/sell holidays and free tea and coffee and fresh fruit.

The office is based in the City Centre/West End - a few minutes' walk from Haymarket Station.

If you'd like to find out more (or are generally interested in new roles in Software Development in Edinburgh/Central Scotland), please apply and/or call Rhona Kennedy at Cathcart Associates for a chat!

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Java Web Aplications
text:
PermanentSenior Software Engineer - Java Web Aplications

Are you a Senior Java Software Engineer who enjoys working on complex web applications enterprise level using modern working methodologies and techniques?

As a Senior Java Developer are you an advocate of TDD, Microservices, Peer Review, CI for developing high availability data for web applications?

Then this is the role for you!

What the role offers:

Team autonomy and ownership on problem solving and developments of new and next generation Java Web Applications
Support to continue to learn and grow as a developer
End-to-end snr swe development from concept, to design patterns, to scoping out a solution / application architecture, to coding, to mentoring
You will:
Have experience on multiple full SDLC in Java Development
At home coding Java Web Applications as you are working on REST / SOAP multi-layer web architecture
Have worked with Open Source and be an Open Source evangelist
Modern best practice experience covering all or at least some of Agile, TDD, Microservices, Continuous Integration, modern Frameworks
Nice to have or at least be interested in learning / working with some of:

Microservices, RDMS, Test Automation, modern best practices such as peer review, Web Application Security, high availability data, version control
Kafka, OpenShift, PL/SQL, Oracle, SQL, JavaScript, AngularJS, Node, Git, BitBucket, Jenkins, Jira, Vaddin, Jasmine, Karma
This is your chance to work with modern best practice in software engineering with a company that really invests in your training and your person well being.

The environment is designed to encourage your creativity as a problem solving SWE and to aid you in innovating the best solutions.

To hear more please apply.
Search is an equal opportunities recruiter and we welcome applications from all suitably skilled or qualified applicants, regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/beliefs, sexual orientation or age.

We are looking for a talented DevOps Engineer with a proven track record of designing, developing and maintaining dependable, mission-critical CI/CD pipelines and systems to help elevate our CI/CD system to a scalable architecture that allows developers to collaborate efficiently regardless of where they are located. You will quickly become an integral member of a global team developing tools for advanced signal processing algorithms, hardware and software solutions.

Responsibilities

Work amongst a platform team driving analysis, design, and development of CI/CD automation tools and workflows
Lead technical sessions with development teams to evaluate their existing DevOps landscape (or possibly lack thereof)
Collaborate globally across team and functional boundaries to help produce resilient and reusable systems throughout a multi-datacenter infrastructure
Enable, oversee, and increase visibility of CI/CD productivity and build status metrics for multiple products and consumers in a consistent manner
Follow Agile-like practices to iteratively design and implement solutions such as task automation, provisioning, orchestration, config management, monitoring, and security hardening
Use mature documentation methods to describe platform capabilities and features to a global set of teams and users
Required Skills and Qualifications
Sound fundamental knowledge of architecting and operating enterprise scale services
Advanced scripting and automation skills, including test-driven-development exposure (we heavily use Powershell/Bash/Python)
Working experience supporting heterogeneous operating systems in live environments (Windows/Linux/MacOSX)
Extensive experience using configuration management tools such as Puppet or Ansible to declare state across an entire fleet
Strong understanding of the virtualization and containerization primitives used for multiple platforms and operating systems
Experience scaling infrastructure-as-code across geographic regions to maintain hybrid on-premise & cloud systems (e.g. Cisco/VMWare/AWS/etc.)
Comfortable using build systems (for compiled and dynamic languages) to target multiple hardware architectures and platforms
Excellent knowledge of package management, artifact repositories, versioning, security scanning, and deployment using tools like JFrog Enterprise
Experience implementing monitoring and logging solutions, to include instrumenting and dashboarding of custom metrics
Advanced experience defining and maintaining build pipelines using Jenkins 2.x pipeline-as-code and shared libraries
Deep understanding of version control practices and code review workflows using tools like SVN, Git, and Gerrit
Proven experience operating effectively while working closely with other IT/development teams throughout a distributed environment

job_title: Technical Lead – systems integration / software solutions
text:
£40,000 - £65,000 a yearPosition: Technical Lead – systems integration / software solutions (financial services sector)

Suitable for: Systems Integration Consultant / Solutions Architect / Agile Project Manager / Software Consultant / Application Development Manager / Software Development Manager…..ideally with experience of systems integration for enterprise scale software solutions

Location: Edinburgh

Salary: £40k – £65k DOE + 10% bonus + bens

Our client is looking for a Technical Lead with experience of systems integration and managing enterprise scale software solution projects from solution design right through to delivery. Ideally you will have grown up through the ranks of software development and progressed to a senior technical leadership or software product specialist role.

The role has huge potential for managing and growing a team and providing product consultancy on an international scale. The client is also open to lesser experienced candidates who show an aptitude for consultancy with strong career aspirations.

Experience / Skills:

Approx 3+ years’ experience as a Technical Lead, Systems Integration Consultant, Software Development Manager, Solutions Architect or similar
Systems integration and enterprise scale software solution delivery
Technical team leading or team management experience
Financial services industry experience (ie wealth management, asset management, Fintech, insurance, Life and Pensions, retail or investment banking)
Software solution design and architecture – from a technical and strategic perspective
Previous background as a Software Developer
Agile software development and/or project management
Must be comfortable in a client facing role and daily interaction with business stakeholders
Desirable:

Previous experience within Java software development
Experience as a Scrum Master
Wealth management or asset management sector experience
Client facing experience gained from a technical consultancy or software vendor
Fintech sector experience
 The Role:

Advising the client on integration options
Defining technical solutions/approaches to support the integration – this includes defining and capturing requirements, proposing and agreeing solutions and producing design documents
Assisting the client with delivery/rollout of software releases
Liaising with the technical and development teams on new and existing changes – ensuring the development team delivers the proposed solution, to quality, within the overall plan
Assisting in trouble shooting and debugging any potential issues with the application
Providing regular communication to senior management and stakeholders
Providing advice to customers across the delivery lifecycle and being the ‘go to’ person for all technical barriers and solving problems
Providing architecture for our teams’ applications aligning with the overall corporate architecture strategy.
Establishing streamlined development processes
Managing risks and issues as they arise, escalating to senior business or technical roles as required
Motivating and mentoring teams to meet their objectives
Ensuring that the team adopts a culture of continuous learning and improvement
 The Company:

Founded in 1999, our client is a relatively small company doing big things. This means the people who work there have the chance to experience a huge variety of work and fast-track their careers by delivering some remarkable projects. There’s no hierarchy or egos to get in the way – just lots of challenges that need addressing from many different directions.

The people are creative and diverse with an adventurous spirit. While they take work seriously, they don’t take themselves the same way. They have quarterly events, plenty of informal pizza meetings and work in a great environment – a converted mill in the middle of Leeds.

Technology is their passion but at heart they are a people business. Everything they do is guided by their values and a determination to be the very best.

The Benefits:

Competitive salary, bonus and holiday entitlement
Pension contributions up to 5% when you contribute 5%
Laptop
Quarterly company events (includes social event)
Regular tech catch ups/hack events
Attend technology events together
Christmas Party (partners are invited)
Summer away day
Childcare Voucher Scheme
Cycle to Work scheme
Online learning subscription

To apply: please e-mail your CV to cv@solosearch.co.uk

Please note: you must be eligible to work in the UK in order for your application to be considered

At Solo Search we take your data privacy seriously, by applying for this vacancy your data will be processed and likely stored on our secure internal systems.

The lawful basis Solo Search use to process your data in regard to this application is legitimate interest and without further consent, your details will be stored for a maximum period of 12 months only.

We will only ever use your data to assist you with your job search and this data will not be shared with any third party, including the client, without your explicit consent.

Our full Data Privacy Policy can be viewed on our website.

job_title: Edinburgh Imaging Software Engineer and Data Manager
text:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer and data manager looking to be actively involved in the support of research imaging activity. Working with “Edinburgh Imaging” (www.edinburghimaging.ed.ac.uk ) we are looking for a full stack software engineer for developing, maintaining and supporting applications in Human Medical Imaging research and for managing Edinburgh Imaging data/related data. The post holder will liaise and work with the Edinburgh Imaging Senior Data Manager, IT and research staff and with other professionals from partner units and facilities within the University and other external organisations such as the NHS.

Edinburgh Imaging exists as three facilities across the city; at the Western General Hospital (WGH), the Royal Infirmary (RIE) and the QMRI. Facilities have been strategically placed to collocate research and clinical services; University scanners operate in NHS hospitals and also NHS services are delivered from University buildings. This facilitates patient scanning alongside research trial recruitment. This role will support all 3 Edinburgh Imaging facilities plus the wider imaging research groups and activity but will be primarily based on the BioQuarter campus (Little France).

Edinburgh Imaging provides a mechanism to facilitate Research and Clinical Imaging, integrating imaging activities of the University of Edinburgh with those of NHS Lothian. Edinburgh imaging couples cutting edge research imaging modalities plus academic and technical expertise with the delivery of clinical imaging services. Both the NHS and the University benefit from this integration. Research is advanced, new techniques and products are developed and patients receive diagnostic scans to help guide their treatment, all from the same facilities. This creates benefits at a societal level, we create solutions to health issues and enhance quality of life via research, clinical service delivery and ongoing education and training.

This Full Time post is offered as Open ended (with review after 3 years).

1. Job Details

Job title: Edinburgh Imaging Software Engineer and Data Manager

School/Support Department: Clinical Services

Unit (if applicable): Edinburgh Imaging

Line manager: Edinburgh Imaging Senior Research Data Manager

2. Job Purpose

Full stack software engineer for developing, maintaining and supporting applications in Human Medical Imaging research, for managing Edinburgh Imaging data and related data.

3. Main Responsibilities

[Front End development for applications so that UI requirements are delivered. Backend Development for applications so that infrastructure and API’s are resilient and consistent] (Approx % of time [50%])

[Deliver a DevOps workflow to services so that they are delivered fast and effectively] (Approx % of time [10%])

[Support medical imaging projects requiring Web apps, databases and virtualisation, such as the UK Dementia Research Institute (DRI) Edinburgh CRF, the Cerebrovascular Disease database, the BRAINS Imagebank and Edinburgh Imaging scan management system amongst others.] (Approx % of time [30%])

[Work with other Scottish HEIs, NHS and Commercial customers to enable secure and appropriate access to clinical imaging data acquired as part of clinical trials and/or required for teaching purposes, data sharing and/or for ensuring ethical management of research imaging data.] (Approx % of time [10%])

4. Planning and Organising

Managing and prioritising personal workload of development tasks using estimation techniques, often working with minimum supervision, within agreed timescales to ensure project deadlines are met. Monitor progress against agreed milestones and, in consultation with the stakeholders and as required take remedial action. Some duties may be urgent and reactive, e.g. providing technical assistance to solve immediate project/service issues.

5. Problem Solving

The ability to solve problems in a timely and effective manner, often under pressure, is essential: as is the ability to work both individually and in a team. Provide specialist technical input to resolve technically complex or critical support issues when required. Responding to changing requirement specifications and advising project managers of likely impact on workload and deadlines.

6. Decision Making

The development and maintenance of services requires decisions in respect of changes which will affect all users of these services, or decisions on technology deployment that will have resource and/or skill implications. The post-holder would be expected to be able to assess risks, consider staff and/or system resource constraints before providing advice in their area of expertise to more senior colleagues. The majority of the day to day decisions, for example fault fixing, and ensuring governance procedures are followed, would not require upward reference.

7. Key Contacts/Relationships

The post holder will liaise and work with the Edinburgh Imaging Senior Data Manager, IT and research staff and with other professionals from partner units and facilities within the University and other external organisations such as the NHS.

8. Knowledge, Skills and Experience Needed for the Job

Essential

Honours degree or post-graduate qualification in computing science (or related subject), and 2+ years’ experience in software development.

Should be proficient in software development and the use of computational tools that support research.

High level of general IT systems knowledge including systems security knowledge

Software Development for research support and task automation in Windows and Linux using Java, MS .Net, PERL, Shell, MATLAB, Python, Scala and other appropriate utilities, e.g. Jenkins, Glassfish, Maven, SQL, Docker, KVM, Vagrant etc

Excellent Linux knowledge and experience, and significant knowledge of the use of distributed computing

Good Windows knowledge and experience. (Active Directory, DNS, NTFS file-system and its security, etc)

Project management experience with medium sized projects.

Experience of medical imaging file formats and protocols; especially DICOM.

Good interpersonal skills with the ability to discern and communicate requirements from others in a non-technical way.

Desirable

Some experience of batch job submission systems / parallel & cluster processing environments, such as sun grid engine for medical image processing using ECDF, compute node style systems.

Should have prior research project experience in this area (experience with imaging data management, ethical and patient security issues would be an advantage).
Should have experience in, or demonstrable interest in, the invention or application of methods and techniques of scientific imaging data curation and exploitation

9. Dimensions

The post-holder reports directly to the Senior Research Data Manager and will be responsible to the Principal Investigator of each research project undertaken. They also work directly with departmental staff members, visitors, students, and collaborators across the University and externally.

10. Job Context and any other relevant information

Edinburgh Imaging houses MRI, PET-CT, PET-MR and e.g. retinal scanners and a cyclotron, which are dedicated to increasing our understanding of the structure (anatomy) of the brain and other areas of the body, e.g. Cardiac, Liver (in terms of chemistry and blood flow) during health, normal ageing and illness. This work is carried out using a wide variety of imaging techniques. Edinburgh Imaging staff work closely with numerous investigators in Scotland and beyond, sharing findings, and learning from others, in order to push forward the frontiers of medical imaging. Over the 20+ years of operation, Edinburgh Imaging has generated vast amounts of research data which now forms an immensely valuable research resource for future investigation. These data must be managed and stored appropriately.

The DRI project aims to further our understanding of neurodegenerative disease, and covers 20% of this post for the next 5 years.

Edinburgh Imaging houses a number of researchers who carry out their own studies alongside core activities that keep the scanners functioning as well as providing external researchers with access to the scanners and the technical expertise to run Imaging studies, therefore the Software Developer and Data Manager role is of vital importance to both internal and external Edinburgh Imaging work.

Salary

The role is grade UE07 and attracts an annual salary of £33,199 to £39,609 for 35 hours each week. Salary is paid monthly by direct transfer to your Bank or Building Society account, normally on the 28th of the month. Salaries for part-time staff are calculated on the full-time scales, pro-rata to the Standard Working Week.

Pension Scheme

To do so, the University of Edinburgh requires to see original documents evidencing right to work in the UK before commencement of employment and this is normally carried out at interview. Details will be provided in any letter of invitation to interview.

For further information on eligibility to work please visit our eligibility to work webpage

In the circumstances where the vacancy does not meet the UK Visa and Immigration advertising, salary and/or qualification level criteria for sponsorship the successful applicant must have the existing right to work in the UK.

All applicants should apply online by clicking the “apply” button at the foot of this page. The application process is quick and easy to follow, and you will receive email confirmation of safe receipt of your application. The online system allows you to submit a CV and other attachments.

Interview date

The University reserves the right to vary the candidate information or make no appointment at all. Neither in part, nor in whole does this information form part of any contract between the University and any individual.



Clinical Research Imaging Centre (CRIC)

The Clinical Research Imaging Centre, which opened in 2009, is a state-of-the-art centre for human integrated imaging, which includes a 320-multidetctor CT scanner (Aquilion ONE; Toshiba), a 3T MR system (Verio; Siemens), and a 128-multidetector PET-CT (mCT Biograph; Siemens). There is also a radiochemistry facility, incorporating a dedicated GE cyclotron. In collaboration with the Welcome Trust Clinical Research Facility there is an innovative Image Analysis Laboratory.
Professor Edwin van Beek and Professor David Newby are the Centre Directors.

The Centre facilitates human clinical and research imaging in close collaboration with NHS Lothian and the SFC Brain Research Imaging Centre, Western General Hospital (BRIC), and in conjunction with the Wellcome Trust Clinical Research Facility. The Centre is supported by a team of multidisciplinary imaging scientists who interface with research teams from all areas of the College and associated organisations to assist and advise on all aspects of the implementation and design of protocols for human imaging of patients and volunteers.

CRIC work closely with well-established centres of research excellence within the University of Edinburgh, such as the Centre for Inflammation Research, Centre for Cardiovascular Science, Reproductive and Developmental Sciences, the SFC Brain Research Imaging Centre, School of Informatics and Academic Radiology, and SINAPSE (Scottish Imaging Network, A Platform for Scientific Excellence), and also has strong collaborations with other institutions nationally, and internationally.



Deanery of Clinical Sciences (http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/clinical-sciences)

The Deanery of Clinical Sciences (Head, Professor Hilary Critchley) has an international reputation in clinical based research through the combination of basic, clinical and translational science and epidemiological studies, and as a part of the College of Medicine and Veterinary Medicine, offers unparalleled opportunities for ground-breaking interdisciplinary research in the bio-medical sciences.
The Deanery comprises 5 interdisciplinary Research Centres: the University of Edinburgh/BHF Centre for Cardiovascular Sciences (Director, Professor Brian Walker), the MRC Centre for Inflammation Research (Director, Professor Moira Whyte), the MRC Centre for Regenerative Medicine (Director, Professor Stuart Forbes), the Centre for Clinical Brain Sciences (Director, Professor Siddharthan Chandran), the MRC Centre for Reproductive Health (Director, Professor Jeff Pollard); plus a Division of Health Sciences (Head, Professor Peter Hayes) incorporating 7 clinical specialties; and the Edinburgh Dental Institute (Director, Professor Angus Walls).

Clinical Sciences employs around 850 members of academic and support staff and has over 550 Honorary members who contribute significantly to teaching and research. The Deanery is a major contributor to the undergraduate MBChB curriculum and has approximately 1000 registered post graduate students studying a range of PhD, MD, taught and research MSc and on-line distance learning programmes. The Deanery can be found at the Little France site (Queen’s Medical Research Institute, Chancellor’s Building, Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh the Scottish Centre for Regenerative Medicine in the Bioquarter), the Royal Hospital for Sick Children, the Lauriston Building, Lauriston Place, the Western General Hospital and the Royal Edinburgh Hospital.
In the most recent UK Research Assessment Exercise, Medicine was ranked in the top 5 for the whole of the UK.


The College of Medicine and Veterinary Medicine

The College of Medicine and Veterinary Medicine The College of Medicine and Veterinary Medicine traces its origins back nearly 500 years (Darwin, Simpson and Conan-Doyle were students here) and is internationally renowned for its research and teaching. Professor Moira Whyte is the Head of College, the only conjoint Medical and Veterinary Medical School in the UK. The College employs over 3000 academic and support staff. The College has two Schools, the Edinburgh Medical School comprising 3 Deaneries; Biomedical Sciences; Molecular Genetic and Population Health Sciences and Clinical Sciences and the Royal (Dick) School of Veterinary Studies.

The Royal (Dick) School of Veterinary Studies

Edinburgh Medical School: Biomedical Sciences

Edinburgh Medical School: Biomedical Sciences, Biomedical Teaching Organisation

Edinburgh Medical School: Molecular, Genetic and Population Health Sciences

Edinburgh Medical School: Clinical Sciences

The undergraduate medicine teaching programme in the College enjoys a high reputation nationally and internationally, with over 1,300 students enrolled on the MBChB and Intercalated courses and nearly 1000 on the Veterinary Sciences BVS and related programmes. In addition, approximately 2000 students are currently enrolled in the College’s taught and research post-graduate courses, including an extensive range of online distance learning diplomas and degrees. They are trained by over 1000 outstanding academic staff. Details of PhDs, research programmes and studentships are available through our interdisciplinary research institutes and centres.

The academic disciplines within Medicine are largely concentrated in the two teaching hospital campuses, the Royal Infirmary at Little France and the Western General Hospital. Both have extensive new infrastructure with major research institutes and state of the art research facilities on clinical sites. Edinburgh hosts a number of prestigious MRC and BHF Research Centres. The approach is interdisciplinary, with basic and clinical researchers working together at the laboratory bench and in our clinical research facilities to address major themes in basic, clinical and translational medicine.

The Royal (Dick) School of Veterinary Studies on the Easter Bush Campus houses outstanding teaching and clinical facilities as well as the splendid Roslin Institute, one of the world’s leading veterinary research centres. The College offers outstanding opportunities to address ‘One Health’ and Global Health problems of the highest international priority.

Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014

The College’s reputation as one of the world’s leading centres of medical and veterinary medical research has been reaffirmed by its UK REF2014 results. Medicine, the University’s largest submission, was ranked in the top 5 in the UK. Veterinary Medicine came 1st in the UK, and retained its position as the UK’s top Vet School. It made a joint submission with Scotland’s Rural College (SRUC). Neuroscience was ranked 3rd in the UK out of 82 submissions, representing a major advance. Overall, 84% of the College’s research activity was rated world leading or internationally excellent (3* and 4*). In terms of 'one medicine' research (human and animal medicine), the University of Edinburgh's research power (quality x volume) is the strongest in the UK.



The University of Edinburgh

For more than four centuries, our people and their achievements have rewritten history time and again. They’ve explored space, revolutionised surgery, published era-defining books, paved the way for life-saving medical breakthroughs and introduced to the world many inventions, discoveries and ideas from penicillin to Dolly the sheep. We have believed that anything is possible, we still do.
The latest Research Excellence Framework highlighted our place at the forefront of international research. This adds to our international reputation for the quality of our teaching and our student experience excellence. The University is proud of its success with online teaching initiatives, with 2550 students currently studying its online distance learning postgraduate programmes, and a total to date of more than 2 million enrolments for Edinburgh MOOCs.

As a member of staff, you will be part of one of the world's leading universities, with 20 Schools spread over 3 Colleges that offer more than 1600 undergraduate and 600 postgraduate programmes to over 41,000 students each year. Professional services are critical to this success as well as our world-class teaching, research and student facilities. In fact, we are one of the top employers in Edinburgh, with over 14,500 people spread across a wide range of academic and supporting roles.

As a world-changing, world-leading university, we offer an exciting, positive, creative, challenging and rewarding place to work. We give you support, nurture your talent, develop and reward success and integrate academic, professional and personal career goals, as well as give your career the benefit of a great and distinguished reputation. In addition, our employees benefit from a competitive reward package and a wide range of staff benefits, which include generous holiday entitlement, a defined benefits pension scheme, staff discounts and much more. Access our staff benefits page for further information and use our reward calculator to find out the total value of pay and benefits provided.

The University of Edinburgh holds a Silver Athena SWAN award in recognition of our commitment to advance gender equality in higher education. We are members of the Race Equality Charter and we are also Stonewall Scotland Diversity Champions, actively promoting LGBT equality. The University has a range of initiatives to support a family friendly working environment, including flexible working and childcare vouchers. See our University Initiatives website for further information.

The team is expanding and this is a great opportunity to help take a lead on our offering in Scotland going forwards. The role would suit a candidate that is either already working in an energy consultancy team, or in building services/ MEP and seeking a more dedicated energy opportunity.

This position would be primarily based in Edinburgh, with some time expected in Manchester/ Leeds and London and wider depending on projects. Whilst some of the projects will be local in the North of England and Scotland, there will be some fantastic opportunities to collaborate across the practice.

You will be reporting to an Associate Director based in Leeds which is a multi-disciplinary office. There are close links to our offices throughout the UK including Manchester, Leeds, London and our head office in Bath.

You will be responsible for a diverse range of activities, from detailed analysis, modelling and design to providing day to day guidance and mentoring to graduate and engineer level staff. You will be expected to lead projects and help manage existing and new client relationships across our portfolio of energy clients from estate managers, property developers, local and regional government to national level policy related work.

You will be supported in day to day work by the local office and a very dynamic energy team with ambitions to work on some of the most challenging and innovative projects that our clients present to BuroHappold. Required Skills

Experience and understanding of building integrated and utility scale energy systems.
Knowledge of UK and in particular Scottish Government energy policy and regulatory drivers of energy and carbon efficiency across a range of project scales.

Knowledge and design experience of plant rooms, energy centres, district heating, electricity generation, CHP and renewables.
Experience working with greenhouse gas emissions calculations.
Experience liaising with different stakeholders, both in the private and public sector
Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate detailed design and technical subjects to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to work autonomously and make design decisions.
Ability to travel
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Degree educated, preferably in mechanical, electrical, building services or civil engineering discipline
Minimum 5 years’ experience in a related field.
Chartered engineer, CIBSE/ IMECHE/ CEI/ ICE (some consideration will be given for the right candidate if nearing chartership)

Energy and heat mapping
Advanced knowledge of MSExcel
Techno-economic modelling
A good awareness of design beyond own discipline.
Large-scale master planning experience.
Experience working with energy software, e.g. EnergyPro, Termis, NetSIM, ETAP etc.
Experience in AutoCAD and Revit

job_title: Automation Tester : Selenium, Java, JavaScript, C# – Newcastle- £40-55,000 + Additional Benefits
text:
£40,000 - £55,000 a yearPermanentAutomation Tester – Selenium, Java, JavaScript, C# – Edinburgh – £40-55,000 + Additional Benefits

My client is currently recruiting for an Automation tester working with a market leading organisation based in Edinburgh. If you have working experience at a hands on level using any Automation testing tools then I would be keen to hear from you.

The Role

Working with a market leader you will have a broad knowledge of automation testing and will have plenty of experience working alongside developers and other testers. The role will involve building large-scale, bespoke, business-critical systems. To be successful in this application you must have a strong technical understanding of Automation and you’ll be a highly skilled, experienced critical thinker, looking for an exciting and challenging role.

You should have:

A passion for and plenty of experience testing software
Excellent attention to detail
Expert understanding of and the ability to provide leadership on a range of testing engagements
Knowledge of one or more of Java, C#.NET, JavaScript, JUnit, TestNG, HTML, CSS, SQL
Experience with end-to-end test automation, eg. Selenium, Jasmine, Protractor
Experience of Continuous Integration systems
An understanding of oracles, heuristics and generation of testing ideas
Exposure to the full software development lifecycle and Agile/Scrum methodology
Experience of context-driven testing principles
It would also be great if you have:

A relevant university degree
Experience in a commercial working environment
Involvement in open source projects
Experience in Technical and Operational Testing
If you are interested in this fantastic position please apply now with an up to date CV for immediate consideration.

job_title: Senior or Associate Energy Engineer- Edinburgh
text:
PermanentBuroHappold brings together the expertise of world class engineers, economists and consultants to examine buildings and cities from a variety of angles, giving our clients a unique picture of the challenges to tackle and the assets and opportunities their project can capitalise on. Working on a diverse range of fascinating projects that cover complex buildings, urban development, infrastructure planning and design, resource management, and programme delivery, BuroHappold is at the forefront of innovation.

We have a strong Energy team both in the UK and across our international offices in Berlin, New York, LA, Riyadh and Hong Kong. The energy team is working on a range of UK and international projects from campus scale up to city and regional planning, and also undertakes commercial research for energy companies, NGOs and government.

Type of contract
Permanent
Grade
Senior, Associate
Area of Expertise
Cities
Region
UK
Office / Project Location
Edinburgh
Ref No
3161

The team is expanding and this is a great opportunity to help take a lead on our offering in Scotland going forwards. We are currently sole consultant for a low carbon heat framework with Zero Waste Scotland running through to 2020 with a great range of projects. This is in addition to a number of other projects emerging due to our reputation and increased profile in the region.

The role would suit a candidate that is either already working in an energy consultancy team, or in building services/ MEP and seeking a more dedicated energy opportunity.

This position would be primarily based in Edinburgh, with some time expected in Manchester/ Leeds and London and wider depending on projects. Whilst some of the projects will be local in the North of England and Scotland, there will be some fantastic opportunities to collaborate across the practice.

You will be reporting to an Associate Director based in Leeds which is a multi-disciplinary office. There are close links to our offices throughout the UK including Manchester, Leeds, London and our head office in Bath.

You will be responsible for a diverse range of activities, from detailed analysis, modelling and design to providing day to day guidance and mentoring to graduate and engineer level staff. You will be expected to lead projects and help manage existing and new client relationships across our portfolio of energy clients from estate managers, property developers, local and regional government to national level policy related work.

You will be supported in day to day work by the local office and a very dynamic energy team with ambitions to work on some of the most challenging and innovative projects that our clients present to BuroHappold. Required Skills

Experience and understanding of building integrated and utility scale energy systems.
Knowledge of UK and in particular Scottish Government energy policy and regulatory drivers of energy and carbon efficiency across a range of project scales.
Consultancy experience, including project management and client relationships, and supporting the preparation for technical proposals for new work.
Co-ordination with other engineers including civil engineers, sustainability, water specialists, structures and MEP to ensure the successful implementation of energy systems and utility strategies.
Awareness of alternative procurement routes, e.g. self-lay, ICP, IGT, IDNO and ESCo arrangements
Knowledge and design experience of plant rooms, energy centres, district heating, electricity generation, CHP and renewables.
Experience working with greenhouse gas emissions calculations.
Experience liaising with different stakeholders, both in the private and public sector
Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate detailed design and technical subjects to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to work autonomously and make design decisions.
Ability to travel
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Degree educated, preferably in mechanical, electrical, building services or civil engineering discipline
Minimum 5 years’ experience in a related field.
Chartered engineer, CIBSE/ IMECHE/ CEI/ ICE (some consideration will be given for the right candidate if nearing chartership)

Desirable skills

Energy and heat mapping
Advanced knowledge of MSExcel
Techno-economic modelling
A good awareness of design beyond own discipline.
Large-scale master planning experience.
Experience working with energy software, e.g. EnergyPro, Termis, NetSIM, ETAP etc.
Experience in AutoCAD and Revit

PermanentAutomation Test Lead

Are you looking for the opportunity to own the automated and technical testing strategy for a global business?

This is a great chance for an experienced tester to take the step up into a lead role where you will lead a team of testers to help them in identifying, prioritising and developing testing activities. Within this role, you'll be responsible for the team in terms of setting testing strategy and defining the test framework but will not have any line management responsibility to allow you to focus on your role.
Role responsibilities include:

Work closely with wider team of testers, BA's and Developers to identify automation opportunities within the business
Prioritise workload across multiple teams
Lead other testers to maximise their potential
Ownership of R&D testing for frameworks and tools
Manage stakeholders and be an advocate for the benefits of automation of processes for the wider business

You'll bring:

Software testing experience in the financial services industry, ideally with experience within asset management
Solid understanding of the principles of software testing with experience working with a variety of techniques and tools
Experience developing frameworks and implementing automation techniques
Strong communication skills, confident managing stakeholders and leading a team
Knowledge of MS SQL as well as performance and test automation tools
A background in software testing in an agile environment
This is a great opportunity to play a key role in a business that's going through an exciting period of change. This is not a hands on testing role so it would be ideal for someone who is looking to own the testing strategy for a global business. This person has the potential to make a positive impact on the business with long term career progression available.

If this sounds like the type of role you are looking for - please apply in the first instance.
